sentences.text: The reliability tests report lots of crashers happening in the CLD library.
The language detection has been temporarily disabled.
Some of the URLS reported as crashing:

__tmainCRTStartup+0x176 [f:\dd\vctools\crt_bld\self_x86\crt\src\crt0.c @ 324]
WARNING: Stack unwind information not available.

When the language detection has been reenabled, the following tests should be 
reenabled:
(note for some of them only part of the test has been disabled).
The following revision refers to this bug:
The reliability tests are reporting lots of crashers
Temporarily disabling the CLD detection while investigating.
The following revision refers to this bug:

Disabling browser tests that are testing the language detection,
since language detection is temporarily disabled.
Marking Crash-TopCrasher as it still affects v4 Beta
The following revision refers to this bug:
The code would crash if multiple PageContents notifications
TabContents directly and the TabContents ensures only one
language detection can be performed at a time.
Added unit-tests to validate these cases in web_contents_unittest.cc.
Note that patch set 1 is the original patch, patch set 2 contains the new changes.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Revert 35735 - Relanding the language detection code.
Still causes redness on the reliability bot.
The code would crash if multiple PageContents notifications
TabContents directly and the TabContents ensures only one
language detection can be performed at a time.
Added unittests to validate these cases in web_contents_unittest.cc.
Note that patch set 1 is the original patch, patch set 2 contains the new changes.
removing Crash-TopCrasher label since we won't see in the field.
The following revision refers to this bug:
3rd attempt at landing the language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Revert 36362 - It breaks NACLTests and Chrome Frame Tests
3rd attempt at landing the language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.
The following revision refers to this bug:
It caused several tests to fails previously.
Cannot repro any of the failure.
I am suspecting a clobber would have probably fixed it.
(there is a change in one of the IPC messages that probably messed up the build somehow).
Enabling language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.
The following revision refers to this bug:
It caused several tests to fails previously.
Cannot repro any of the failure.
I am suspecting a clobber would have probably fixed it.
(there is a change in one of the IPC messages that probably messed up the build somehow).
Enabling language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.
The following revision refers to this bug:
* base::IsValidCodepoint() now returns false on non-character code points.
* base::IsStringUTF8() now uses ICU library (removed old Mozilla implementation).
* file_util::ReplaceIllegalCharactersInPath() now treats Unicode replacement character (U+FFFD) as invalid.
The following revision refers to this bug:
* base::IsValidCodepoint() now returns false on noncharacter code points.
* base::IsStringUTF8() now uses ICU library (removed old Mozilla implementation).
* file_util::ReplaceIllegalCharactersInPath() now treats Unicode replacement character (U+FFFD) as invalid.
The following revision refers to this bug:
It caused several tests to fails previously.
There was a crasher in some Windows code in the CLD that has been removed by the port of the CLD code to Linux and Mac.
That should hopefully make everything work now.
Enabling language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.

http://www.3xtoday.com/search just crashed my Linux build (renderer) with the cld 
extension installed, which I guess is equivalent to enabling the language deetction 
by default in terms of crash detection.
Other pages in the list didn't crash the renderer process.
The following revision refers to this bug:
Revert 36589 - Still failing the reliability tests.
It caused several tests to fails previously.
There was a crasher in some Windows code in the CLD that has been removed by the port of the CLD code to Linux and Mac.
That should hopefully make everything work now.
Enabling language detection on page load.
A memory error has been fixed in the CLD library in the meantime.
This should hopefully fixes the crashers in the reliability tests.
Note that this version is actually simpler than the original review since the detection is now performed in the renderer.
The following revision refers to this bug:
One more attempt at landing this CL.
There are now memory errors in the CLD library that cause memory crashers in reliability tests.
I will add reliability failures to the know_crashes.txt file while the memory errors are being fixed.
(No comment was entered for this change.)
All known memory issues in the CLD have been addressed.

title: The CLD (Compact Language Library) crashes on some sites.
